entries.meaning: A covering of cloth or leather for the ankle and instep.
A covering cloth or leather for the whole leg from the knee to the instep, fitting down upon the shoe.
Part of the ecclesiastical garb of a bishop.

verbs.description: gaiter (third-person singular simple present gaiters, present participle gaitering, simple past and past participle gaitered)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, dialectal) The dogwood, or a similar shrub.
